definition: the Great Hall of the People in Beijing
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
surname Min
the people/nationality/citizen
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to balance an account/accountancy/accounting
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

(main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture

sentences.english: Opening ceremony of the 2011 Summer Camp at the Guangxi - Great Hall of the People.
sentences.chinese: 在南宁市的广西人民大会堂举行开营仪式。

sentences.english: I think the splendid building on the west side must be the Great Hall of the People.
sentences.chinese: 我想西边那座宏伟建筑一定是人民大会堂了。

sentences.english: The banquet was held in the brightly-lit Great Hall of the People.
sentences.chinese: 宴会在灯火辉煌的人民大会堂举行。

sentences.english: The Great Hall of the People is beflagged.
sentences.chinese: 人民大会堂上插满旗子。

sentences.english: The Great Hall of the People was built in 1959.
sentences.chinese: 人民大会堂是在一九五九年修建的。

sentences.english: Tian An Men Square is flanked by the Great Hall of the People and the Museum of the Chinese Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 天安门广场两侧是人民大会堂和中国革命博物馆。

sentences.english: The guests gathered in the banquet hall, the Great Hall of the People, which was filled with warm and festive atmosphere. The national emblem was placed above the podium.
sentences.chinese: 人民大会堂宴会厅内宾朋济济一堂，气氛喜庆热烈。

definition: Huairen Hall or Huairentang, a building inside Zhongnanhai 中南海[Zhong1 nan2 hai3], used as the main meeting place of the Politburo of the CCP
president (title of the head of state of China and several other nations)
Tiananmen Gate, entrance of the Imperial City in Beijing
Tiananmen Square
abbr. for 全國人大會議|全国人大会议[Quan2 guo2 Ren2 Da4 hui4 yi4], National People's Congress (NPC)
Zhongnanhai, palace adjacent to the Forbidden City, now the central headquarters of the Communist Party and the State Council
the curtain falls/lower the curtain/to come to an end (of a meeting)
national general congress/Communist party national congress, in recent times every five years
pinyin: quan2 guo2 dai4 biao3 da4 hui4

definition: opening ceremony
state guesthouse
Jiang Zemin (1926-), politician, president of PRC 1993-2003
Hu Jintao (1942-), General Secretary of the CCP 2002-2012, president of the PRC 2003-2013
China National Art Gallery
abbr. for 中國文學藝術界聯合會|中国文学艺术界联合会, China Federation of Literary and Art Circles (CFLAC)
National People's Congress (NPC)
pinyin: Quan2 guo2 Ren2 Da4 hui4 yi4

definition: Peng Liyuan (1962-), PRC folk music singer, wife of Xi Jinping 習近平|习近平[Xi2 Jin4 ping2]
